body:
Comment 7 by **ryan@rmarcus.info**: 
Alex,

I went through all that. I figured Windows support would be dicey.

At some point, I'll just take my code home from work and use my home machine (which, of
course, runs a much more tolerable operating system :) ). Until then, I'll just have to
keep things going in my own private repository.

I'm also not satisfied with the little endian "hack" I posted from above... it really
seems like the binary package should be used, but it degrades performance drastically.
The profiling tools (another excellent bowl of fun to get working on Windows, by the
way) showed a large amount of time in runtime.mallocgc, which I can't find any
documentation on, but I assume is a garbage collection routine. I'll look into it more
tomorrow.
